tipItems.title: Be Patient and Consistent
tipItems.content: Learning English requires time and patience. Commit to your journey, and don’t give up if you feel frustrated.

tipItems.title: Assess Your Level
tipItems.content: Start by determining your current English level using a specialized website. After six months, retake the test to evaluate your progress and notice the difference in your skills.

tipItems.title: Focus on Listening
tipItems.content: Browse videos, pick content that suits your needs, and follow a structured listening routine to absorb grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation naturally.

tipItems.title: Imitate Pronunciation
tipItems.content: Mimic correct pronunciation from videos and use tools like Google Translate for additional help.

tipItems.title: Learn New Words and Expressions
tipItems.content: Memorize 10 new words and 3 expressions daily. Track them in a notebook for better retention.

tipItems.title: Practice Grammar through Listening
tipItems.content: Improve grammar by consistently listening to relevant videos and applying what you’ve learned.

tipItems.title: Read Daily
tipItems.content: Read aloud daily to improve fluency and confidence.

tipItems.title: Practice Writing
tipItems.content: Write short topics in your native language, translate them into English, and refine your skills through practice.

tipItems.title: Stay Organized
tipItems.content: Choose videos that suit your level, revisit them often, and stay consistent for better retention.

tipItems.title: Use Subtitles (CC)
tipItems.content: Use YouTube subtitles to help translate and comprehend video content.

tipItems.title: Daily Practice
tipItems.content: Dedicate two hours daily to learning and applying your skills in real-life conversations.
